project_abstract.cdata: The Recurrent Costs and Reform Financing Project for Somalia seeks to make the following changes to the project: a) An extension of the closing date by two months to enable financing of eligible civil service salaries in non-security sectors in Mogadishu; and salaries and allowances for Subject Matter Experts for January and February 2015. Additionally, it will facilitate the extension of contracts of consultants supporting the External Affairs Fiduciary Section (EAFS) for project implementation to April 2015. b) A reallocation from component three and two to component one to finance the payments of civil service salaries in non-security sectors and payment of fees and allowances to Subject Matter Experts who are supporting the core government functions for the months of January to March. c) A revision of the Results Framework based on the findings of the mid-term review to be able to better measure the PDO indicators, baselines, progress data and targets for all indicators and adjust and/or add any indicators to show all the results that the project has been achieved. There are no changes in the PDO.
